briefdescription.para: Create or overwrite file.
Create or overwrite layer.
Append features to existing layer, but do not create new fields.
Append features to existing layer, and create new fields if needed.
Combination of CanAddNewLayer, CanAppendToExistingLayer, CanAddNewFieldsToExistingLayer or CanDeleteLayer.

simplesect.para: QGIS 3.0 Enumeration to describe how to handle existing files

briefdescription.para: Flag to indicate that a new layer can be added to the dataset.
Flag to indicate that new features can be added to an existing layer.
Flag to indicate that new fields can be added to an existing layer. Imply CanAppendToExistingLayer.
Flag to indicate that an existing layer can be deleted.
Edition capability flags.
Use recommended sort order, with extremely commonly used formats listed first.
Filter out any formats which do not have spatial support (e.g. those which cannot save geometries)
Options for sorting and filtering vector formats.
Writing was interrupted by manual cancelation.
Map attribute indizes to OGR field indexes.
Contains error value if construction was not successful.
Field value converter.
Scale for symbology export (e.g. for symbols units in map units)
Geometry type which is being used.

memberdef.name: areThereNewFieldsToCreate

briefdescription.para: Returns whether there are among the attributes specified some that do not exist yet in the layer.
Converts codec name to string passed to ENCODING layer creation option of OGR Shapefile.
Returns a list of the default dataset options for a specified driver.

parameterdescription.para: name of OGR driver

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of the default layer options for a specified driver.

parameterdescription.para: name of OGR driver

briefdescription.para: Delete a shapefile (and its accompanying shx / dbf / prf)

parameterdescription.para: /path/to/file.shp

simplesect.para: bool true if the file was deleted successfully

briefdescription.para: Returns the OGR driver name for a specified file extension.

detaileddescription.para:
E.g. the driver name for the ".shp" extension is "ESRI Shapefile". If no suitable drivers are found then an empty string is returned.
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns edition capabilities for an existing dataset name.
Returns filter string that can be used for dialogs.

detaileddescription.para: The options argument can be used to control the sorting and filtering of returned drivers.

briefdescription.para: Creates a filter for an OGR driver key.
Returns the driver list that can be used for dialogs.

detaileddescription.para: It contains all OGR drivers plus some additional internal QGIS driver names to distinguish between more supported formats of the same OGR driver.
The returned list consists of structs containing the driver long name (e.g. user-friendly display name for the format) and internal driver short name.
The options argument can be used to control the sorting and filtering of returned drivers.

briefdescription.para: Gets the ogr geometry type from an internal QGIS wkb type enum.

detaileddescription.para:
Will drop M values and convert Z to 2.5D where required.
not available in Python bindings

briefdescription.para: Returns a list or pairs, with format filter string as first element and OGR format key as second element.

detaileddescription.para: The options argument can be used to control the sorting and filtering of returned formats.

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of file extensions for supported formats, e.g "shp", "gpkg".

detaileddescription.para: The options argument can be used to control the sorting and filtering of returned formats.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the specified driverName supports feature styles.

detaileddescription.para: The driverName argument must be a valid GDAL driver name.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the target layer already exists.

memberdef.argsstring: (QgsVectorLayer *layer, const QString &fileName, const QString &fileEncoding, const QgsCoordinateReferenceSystem &destCRS=QgsCoordinateReferenceSystem(), const QString &driverName="GPKG", bool onlySelected=false, QString *errorMessage=nullptr, const QStringList &datasourceOptions=QStringList(), const QStringList &layerOptions=QStringList(), bool skipAttributeCreation=false, QString *newFilename=nullptr, QgsVectorFileWriter::SymbologyExport symbologyExport=QgsVectorFileWriter::NoSymbology, double symbologyScale=1.0, const QgsRectangle *filterExtent=nullptr, QgsWkbTypes::Type overrideGeometryType=QgsWkbTypes::Unknown, bool forceMulti=false, bool includeZ=false, const QgsAttributeList &attributes=QgsAttributeList(), QgsVectorFileWriter::FieldValueConverter *fieldValueConverter=nullptr, QString *newLayer=nullptr)
memberdef.name: writeAsVectorFormat

briefdescription.para: Write contents of vector layer to an (OGR supported) vector format.

parameterdescription.para: layer to write
file name to write to
encoding to use
CRS to reproject exported geometries to, or invalid CRS for no reprojection
OGR driver to use
write only selected features of layer
pointer to buffer fo error message
list of OGR data source creation options
list of OGR layer creation options
only write geometries
QString pointer which will contain the new file name created (in case it is different to fileName).
symbology to export
scale of symbology
if not a null pointer, only features intersecting the extent will be saved (added in QGIS 2.4)
set to a valid geometry type to override the default geometry type for the layer. This parameter allows for conversion of geometryless tables to null geometries, etc (added in QGIS 2.14)
set to true to force creation of multi* geometries (added in QGIS 2.14)
set to true to include z dimension in output. This option is only valid if overrideGeometryType is set. (added in QGIS 2.14)
attributes to export (empty means all unless skipAttributeCreation is set)
field value converter (added in QGIS 2.16)
QString pointer which will contain the new layer name created (in case it is different to the provided layer name) (added in QGIS 3.4, not available in python)

memberdef.name: init

briefdescription.para: A convenience class for writing vector files to disk.

detaileddescription.para:
There are two possibilities how to use this class:
static call to QgsVectorFileWriter::writeAsVectorFormat(...) which saves the whole vector layer
create an instance of the class and issue calls to addFeature(...)
